intro: Baumea schoenoides, commonly known as the silver grass, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its silvery-blue foliage and delicate, feathery inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to form dense, low-growing mats. Baumea schoenoides is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife.
